CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. The function creates new elements and sets their text content based on input values. If these input values are not properly sanitized and contain malicious scripts, they can be executed in the user's browser when the page is rendered. This can lead to various harmful actions, such as stealing sensitive data or performing actions on behalf of the user.
